results.title: Cuba and Fidel
results.creator_credit: David Davis, Saul Landau, Christine Burrill, Churchill Films and Focal Point
results.brief_description: The film focuses on an interview with Fidel Castro interwoven with aspects of Cuba. Castro speaks about differences with the United States which led to severed relations, about changes in Cuba since the revolution, about socialism and capitalism. He defends Cuba’s “coercive” society on economic grounds as a necessity during a transition period. The camera follows him on tours of inspection, particularly to a new housing project where he visits an apartment that overflows with residents. The film shows the contrasts of old and new, industrialization and poverty.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Davis, Saul Landau, Christine Burrill, Churchill Films and Focal Point

results.title: The Cub scout in the pack
results.creator_credit: Boy Scouts of America. Visual Education Service
results.brief_description: The film illustrates a typical Cub Pack theme, in this case a circus, from beginning to end. Emphasis is placed in the part played by the Cub-master, Den Mothers, Den Dads, Den Chief, parents and Cub Scouts.

results.title: The Cub scout in the den
results.creator_credit: Boy Scouts of America. Visual Education Service
results.brief_description: Shows a typical cub Den in operation including the procedure of a Den meeting. Illustrates the roles played by Den Mother, Den Dad, Den Chief and Denner. Shows how the monthly theme is worked into the Den meeting program and how typical “disciplinary” problems are correctly handled.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Boy Scouts of America. Visual Education Service

results.title: The CSL veterinary story
results.creator_credit: Barry Scott and Commonwealth Serum Laboratories (Australia)
results.brief_description: Manufacture of vaccines at the Commonwealth Serum Laboratories; field stations where animals are kept for the preparation and testing of vaccines; production of penicillin, Salk vaccine and Pulpy Kidney vaccine at the laboratories at Parkville. Over 600 valuable and life-saving products are made to which rigid standards of research and production are applied.

results.title: Crystals: an introduction
results.brief_description: Introduces the subject of crystals by demonstrating the orderly arrangement of atoms in the crystalline state and the relation of this arrangement to the physical properties of the substances.

results.title: Crystals
results.brief_description: This film shows us the various processes by which crystals are formed, including that of salts in solution by evaporation; of rock formations by percolation of water through the earth; of the melting and cooling of minerals; and the crystallisation of substances in solutions contained in the cells of various plants. Actual crystallisation is recorded by means of time-lapse micro-cinematography.

results.title: Crystallization
results.creator_credit: Carroll Ballard, Churchill Films and Dimension Films
results.brief_description: The filming of magnified forms of crystals of common solutions as they are seen forming and then melting in polarized light captures the natural evolving shapes in a kaleidoscope of colour and in an infinite series of abstractions. Visually fascinating, all process were filmed at low magnification. Music by Phil Bishop, microphotography/crystalography by Robert R. Forrester and narration by Marguerite Ray. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Crustaceans: lobsters, barnacles, shrimps and their relative
results.creator_credit: William A. Anderson and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The appearances, habitat and behaviour of the most important types of Crustaceans are shown. The distinguishing features of the five tuypes are illustrated with close-up views of the animals in their natural environment. Designed for high school classes in biology and zoology.

results.title: The Crusades: saints and sinners
results.creator_credit: Victor Vicas and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Describes the first crusade, early in the 11th century, and the complex motives which led thousands of people to journey to the Holy Land. The climactic taking of Jerusalem is recreated, and the irony implicit in the concept of a holy war is examined.

results.title: Crusade
results.creator_credit: Frank Donovan, American Cancer Society and Frank Donovan Associates
results.brief_description: Describes the three-fold program of the American Cancer Society: depicts the volunteer effort to save lives through education and to give help to the cancer patient in service; and discusses the hope for the future of the national research program. Narrated by Spencer Tracy.
